definition: life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
to have disregard for human life (idiom)
see 草菅人命[cao3 jian1 ren2 ming4]

sentences.english: It exists in the space of a breath. Life ends when the breathing stops.
sentences.chinese: 人命只在呼吸間，一秒間過不了關，生命就結束了。
這是一起人命關天的事。

sentences.english: Their only suspect, Alexis Drazen, has half a chance of surviving.
sentences.chinese: 他們的唯一疑犯，亞歷克西斯，只剩下半條人命了。

sentences.english: I guess that really is a killer outfit.
sentences.chinese: 我看這真的是套要人命的衣服。

sentences.english: Belittled life results from belittled laws.
Under the pretext of opposition to the US-British occupation of the terrorists, depending on human life such as ants.
sentences.chinese: 藉口反對美英佔領的恐怖主義者，視人命如螻蟻。

sentences.english: So that’s more than 7000 people that could be saved by a rat.
sentences.chinese: 所以老鼠可以挽救7000多條人命喲。

sentences.english: Their only suspect Alexis Drazen has half a chance of surviving.
sentences.chinese: 他們的唯一疑犯，亞歷克西斯，只剩下半條人命了。

sentences.english: Malaria, as we all know, kills  approximately one million people a year.
sentences.chinese: 虐疾，如我們所知，每年奪走大約一百萬條人命。

sentences.english: La vida de una niñ; a no vale absolutamente nada en China.
sentences.chinese: 在中國一個女孩子的人命根本什麼都不值。

sentences.english: I’m not sure what he used, but it was hot as hell.
sentences.chinese: 我不清楚他拿的是什麼東西，但熱的要人命。

sentences.english: With a knife the knitter ends hellos wife's life in the lifeboat.
sentences.chinese: 在救生艇上編織者用小刀竣事了他妻子的人命。

sentences.english: North Korea lead to loss of life of land.
Lead to loss of life of Chinese money.
Each loss matters. Each death counts.
sentences.chinese: 損失事關重大，死亡人命關天。

definition: to have disregard for human life (idiom)
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
to dispose of a matter/to be done with it
death cannot wipe out the crimes (idiom); dreadful crimes that rankled even after the perpetrator is dead
to lose one's life/to get killed
to pay for sth with the loss of (one's health etc)/to have sth come at the cost of (one's reputation etc)
vitally important/a matter of life and death
